title: Reverse a string
description: Write a function reverse_string(s) that reverses a string.

title: Sum list (ignore non-numbers)
description: Write sum_numbers(lst) that returns the sum of all integer or float values in lst and ignores all other types.

title: Safe divide
description: Write safe_divide(a, b). If b = 0 return the string 'zero division'. Otherwise return a/b.

title: Find longest word in sentence
description: Write function longest_word(sentence) that returns the longest word. Ignore punctuation.

title: Count character frequency
description: Write char_frequency(s) that returns a dictionary mapping each character to its count.

title: Remove duplicates while preserving order
description: Write unique_list(lst) that removes duplicates but keeps order.

title: Validate email
description: Write is_valid_email(email). A valid email has exactly one '@', at least one '.', and no spaces.

title: Compute running average
description: Write running_average(lst) that returns list of averages for prefixes.

title: Find second largest
description: Write second_largest(lst). If list has less than 2 unique values return null.

title: Balanced parentheses checker
description: Write is_balanced(s) to check if parentheses (), [], {} are balanced.

title: Parse CSV user data
description: Given a CSV line 'name,age,active', return a dict with keys 'name' (str), 'age' (int), and 'active' (bool). 'active' is 'true' or 'false' (case-insensitive). Trim whitespace. If age is not a valid integer, return None.

title: Door state machine
description: Simulate a simple door state machine. Initial state is 'CLOSED'. Given a list of events, return the final state. Valid events: 'open', 'close', 'lock', 'unlock'. Rules: CLOSED -> 'open' -> OPEN; OPEN -> 'close' -> CLOSED; CLOSED -> 'lock' -> LOCKED; LOCKED -> 'unlock' -> CLOSED. All other transitions leave the state unchanged.
